newsitem.title: USA: Enron Oil says Uzbek venture talks progress.
newsitem.headline: Enron Oil says Uzbek venture talks progress.

text.p: Enron Oil & Gas said talks to form a natural gas joint venture in Uzbekistan were continuing and it has made progress in a deal that has been on the table since 1994.
"We have made significant progress and we are working harder on the commercial side of negotiations rather than on other details and transportation," said a spokesman for Enron Oil & Gas.
The company initially signed a memorandum of understanding in 1994 and that had been extended since then.
The Enron spokesman said that while the company hoped for a deal before the yearend, he could not put a date on it.
The company is examining the possibility of transporting gas using the pipelines of Russian gas monopoly RAO Gazprom to Western Europe.
Gazprom delivered significant quantities of Uzbek natural gas when the country was part of the Soviet Union.
The Uzbek government said today Enron's venture could be the first of several joint venture projects to be realised.

It covers 6.0 trillion cubic feet of natural gas, with the potential to approach 20 trillion cubic feet and possible potential reserves of 400 million barrels of liquids. ((-- David Chance New York Newsroom 212 859 1902))
